intro: Racosperma rendlei, commonly known as the Mount Baw Baw wattle, is a small shrub native to Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant features trifoliate leaves with a distinctive yellow to orange coloration, and its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters. It is adapted to rocky and dry habitats, showcasing resilience to arid conditions. Racosperma rendlei plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and shelter for small fauna.
